intro: Haplopappus ischnos, commonly known as the narrowleaf pappus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. Its structure includes a basal rosette of leaves and a flowering stem that rises above them. Haplopappus ischnos is adapted to arid environments, with features that help it conserve water and survive in dry conditions.
